alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 29 at 10:59PM EST until January 30 at 9:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills 10 to 15 below zero. * WHERE...Warren County. * WHEN...Until 9 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Bitterly cold wind chills are now expected to continue until Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Limit time outside. Dress in layers and cover exposed skin. Wear a hat and gloves. Frostbite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Review winter weather safety and preparedness information at weather.gov/winter. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
